headline.main: FOUNDLING BABIES.; How they are Cared For.

docs.lead_paragraph: Now and then paragraph find their way into the papers telling of strange packages left at home citizen's door, of baskets filled with unmarketable freight discovered by policemen in alley-ways or vacant rooms, or of infants, too young to know what it is to Silve a mother's care, left in stages or by places to be looked after by some benevolent stranger. Itemslike theee occur too frequently to attractrauch attention.

docs.snippet: We have received advanced sheets of an interesting and important document about to be issued by the " Sabbath Committee," on the Sunday liquor traffic. Few public papers, of similar tenor, deserve, or are likely to receive, more general attention....
docs.lead_paragraph: We have received advanced sheets of an interesting and important document about to be issued by the " Sabbath Committee," on the Sunday liquor traffic. Few public papers, of similar tenor, deserve, or are likely to receive, more general attention. The nature and magnitude of the evil exposed, and the source and manner of the discussion, alike claim the candid consideration of all good citizens.

docs.snippet: THE DIVORCE LAW IN INDIANA-A HUSBAND'S DIFFICULTIES. The Indianapolis Journal has the following: "In the discussion on amendments to the divorce law in the Senate yesterday morning. a case was revealed wherein a gentleman In Leavenworth, Kansas, had...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE DIVORCE LAW IN INDIANA-A HUSBAND'S DIFFICULTIES. The Indianapolis Journal has the following: "In the discussion on amendments to the divorce law in the Senate yesterday morning. a case was revealed wherein a gentleman In Leavenworth, Kansas, had furnished his wife with money to visit her friends in the East, and to travel for the benefit of her health.

docs.lead_paragraph: MISS HOLLAND VS. MRS. MURPHY, OR THE ADVANTAGE OF BEING MARRIED AND SINGLE AT THE SAME TIME.-In the Spring of 1837, one DANIEL H. MURPHY, now deceased, leased of Mr. CAMILLE C. docs.snippet: Mr. AMES introduced a bill to authorize the At torncy-General to institute a suit to determine the title to the Washington Market ground, so as to dispose of the same, and appropriate the proceeds to the Canal eniargement. A debate ensued on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. AMES introduced a bill to authorize the At torncy-General to institute a suit to determine the title to the Washington Market ground, so as to dispose of the same, and appropriate the proceeds to the Canal eniargement. A debate ensued on the question of reference, at the close of which, the bill was laid on the table to await the report of the Special Committee on the same subject.

docs.lead_paragraph: A lecture illustrative of Dr. GREEN's mode of treating diseases of tile respiratory organs, and explaining in popular terms the case of the late Mr. SAMUEL S. WHITNEY,--a case which has excited so G much debate in the Academy of Medicine and so much public notice othcrwise,-was delivered last night in Ihe Cooper Institute by Dr. Foy.

headline.main: Last Days and Conversation of the Late Wm II. Prescott--Letter from the Rev. W. H. Milburn.

docs.snippet: We have rather exciting news this morning from the coast of Africa, contained in official correspondence of the Navy Department, which will be found in another column. It seems that on the 11th of October last, the American brigantine Rufus Soule...
docs.lead_paragraph: We have rather exciting news this morning from the coast of Africa, contained in official correspondence of the Navy Department, which will be found in another column. It seems that on the 11th of October last, the American brigantine Rufus Soule which had cleared from Mantanzas for the African coast, was boarded by the British steamer Viper--searched and burned.
